alert.note: Alert for Elbert, Central and East Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet; North Douglas County Below 6000 Feet, Denver, West Adams and Arapahoe Counties, East Broomfield County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 11 at 3:13PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Douglas, southwestern Arapahoe and southwestern Denver Counties through 345 PM MDT... At 313 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over eastern Highlands Ranch, or 12 miles south of Denver, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Southern Denver, southwestern Aurora, Centennial, Highlands Ranch, northern Castle Rock, southwestern Parker, Littleton, Englewood, Greenwood Village, Lone Tree, Sheridan, Castle Pines, Louviers and Sedalia. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM MDT for northeastern Colorado.

area.areaDesc: Elbert, Central and East Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet; North Douglas County Below 6000 Feet, Denver, West Adams and Arapahoe Counties, East Broomfield County
